other_tests.findings: The thoracic region showed a hyperintense signal image in the spinal cord from T6 to T11 levels in T2 and short tau inversion recovery (STIR) sequences, consistent with cytotoxic edema or myelomalacia. Enlarged perimedullary vessels were observed in the posterior epidural region, with hyperintense signal voids in T1 and a hypointense signal in T2 sequences.
Revealed a right perimedullary fistula type I, with a feeding artery from the radiculopial branch and perimedullary venous drainage from the segmental artery of the right L2.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The fistula was satisfactorily embolized with a 20% histoacryl-lipiodol emulsion.
